column1: Fleas are small insects that feed on the blood of humans, dogs, cats, and other warm-blooded animals.
Bites often occur around the waist, ankles, armpits, and in the bend of the elbows and knees.

The rash: - Has small bumps, often three bumps together, that may itch and bleed - May be located on the armpit or fold of a joint (at the elbow, knee, or ankle) - Turns white when pressed - May develop in skin folds, such as under breasts or in the groin Flea bites can also cause swelling around a sore or injury.
The goal of treatment is to get rid of the fleas.
This can be done by treating your home, pets, and outside areas with chemicals (pesticides).
